Happy to chat.Let’s build something meaningful, together.', "We're Hiring Interns!Open Positions:- Generative AI Intern: Work on cutting-edge projects involving Large Language Models (LLMs), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines, LangChain, vector databases, and AI agent workflows.- Full Stack Intern: Develop scalable applications using modern frameworks like Next.js, React, and Node.js, contributing to both frontend and backend systems.Who We're Looking For:- Current students or recent graduates with a passion for hands-on learning.- Curious individuals who love to tinker, code, or research how systems work.- Candidates with impressive side projects or a GitHub/portfolio showcasing their work.What You’ll Gain:- Opportunity to convert to a full-time role based on performance.- Practical experience in real-world product development.- Guidance and mentorship from experienced developers and AI practitioners.- A fast-paced, startup-like culture that emphasizes learning, growth, and ownership.Details:Location: RemoteDuration: 3 MonthsHow to Apply:Email your resume and GitHub/portfolio toprabal@decast.live.", 'Hiring Alert: I am hiring 2 SDE Interns for my company,LearnYard Technologies FZ-LLC► We’re looking for 2 Software Development Interns to join us.► Time Commitment: 4–6 hours/day (weekdays)► Location: RemoteWe’re looking for college students who’ve polished their dev skills through real work, not just tutorials.You’re a good fit if you:—\xa0 Have hands-on experience with React and Fastify—\xa0 Know how to work with Git and GitHub—\xa0 Can commit time consistently and collaborate well with a Senior Engineer—\xa0 Have worked on actual projects or participated in hackathonsWe’re not looking for perfect resumes, just proof that you’ve built things and can keep building.If you’re ready to learn fast and contribute meaningfully, apply here:https://lnkd.in/gnRg8XXfPlease don’t DM me with your applications as I won’t be able to sort through all of them. My team and I will strictly use the form for hiring. Thank you :)', 'Workato is hiring Interns .looking for enthusiastic and driven interns to join our team at Workato. Top MNC  Hiring  Full Time - Entry Level & Remote Job - Salary up to  - Rs 30,000 to 85,000 Per Monthly .Apply Here :-https://lnkd.in/drqR5ptgRole :--  Data entry Jobs -9- Copy paste work -20- Data Entry Level -13- Admin -9- HR-8- Sap -8- Admin -8- Trainee-8- Online Customer support -8- SEO -8- Digital marketing -8- Fresher & College students -10Job Details:-- Bulk Hiring For Freshers,Interns & Part time students.', "Why are freshers struggling to get a job?Major tech giants (Google, Microsoft, Meta, Apple, Tesla, Palantir, Nvidia) have recorded ZERO net headcount growth since 2022. Our Indian IT companies thankfully are still hiring but only because they are investing in the future.Compare that to the pandemic hiring frenzy when these companies added 120,000+ employees in a single year.What changed? 4 key factors:🔸 Pandemic Overhiring Hangover - Companies are still digesting their 2020-2022 hiring spree as demand normalized🔸 Rising Interest Rates - CFOs prioritizing margin discipline over headcount expansion🔸 AI Infrastructure Investment - Billions diverted to GPUs and data centers, leaving less for junior hires🔸 AI Replacing Entry-Level Work - Copilots and automation tools enabling teams to do more with lessThe traditional link between revenue growth and headcount growth is breaking. Companies are testing whether they can grow without growing their teams.For freshers navigating this storm:✅ Build portfolios, not just résumés✅ Master AI tools in your field✅ Freelance/intern strategically✅ Network beyond LinkedIn✅ Target smaller companies and emerging sectorsThe job market isn't broken—it's evolving. The future belongs to those who adapt early, learn fast, and stay visible. Reach out to us atBe Practical Tech Solutionsto understand how we are playing our role in creating such graduates.But here's the real truth - freshers who understand AI, build real projects, and think like founders aren't just employable—they're unstoppable. Managers,Please stop asking for +10 years of industry work experience for entry-level jobs. Ask if the young interns have passion, dedication, and care about helping your customers more than anything else.I think you will get better results hiring kind people who care about others instead of chasing unicorns who lived their entire life with the sole purpose of furthering their career and only caring about making more money.It’s time to reframe what “qualified” looks like. A willingness to learn, a heart for service, and a genuine belief in the company’s vision should carry weight in hiring decisions. Especially for early-career roles.When you prioritize depth of character over depth of résumé, you open the door to individuals who are often the most eager to contribute, grow, and stay loyal to your mission. These are people who may not have a long track record yet, but who carry values that align deeply with your company’s purpose.Hire with your heart!Sincerely,All interns Dear Hiring Managers,Please stop asking for +10 years of industry work experience for entry-level jobs. These are not unpaid or paid internships, but rather, internships where students are required to pay for the opportunity to work.To make matters worse, they have different pricing tiers based on whether or not you receive an “internship offer”:1 month: ₹399 (with an offer), ₹699 (without an offer)Pricing increases up to 6 months with similar plans (goes up to 4k+).While courses and training programs can involve fees, charging students for an internship is unethical. Internships are meant to provide valuable experience and skill development, not to financially exploit aspiring professionals.When I raised concerns about this practice, my questions were ignored and left unanswered.Internships should empower students with opportunities for growth, not create financial barriers. A targeted application stands out way more than a hundred random ones.And to my fellow recruiters - you’re not alone in the chaos!hashtag#PersonalExperiencehashtag#recuiterlifehashtag#TalentAcquisitionhashtag#HiringHumorhashtag#JobSearchTipshashtag#RecruitmentRealityhashtag#TAstorieshashtag#LifeOfARecruiterhashtag#LinkedInHumorhashtag#InternHiringhashtag#ApplyWithPurpose', 'If you’re hiring interns to “save money,”You’re already out of compliance.Let’s clear up the biggest myth:Interns aren’t free labor.And your intent doesn’t override the law.Here’s what most companies get wrong:1. Stipend isn’t optional: If the intern is doing actual work (not just learning), a stipend is ethically and legally expected. Unpaid internships ≠ “great exposure.” That’s exploitation.2. Offer letters must be formal: An internship offer should mention duration, stipend, reporting manager, and work expectations. An email saying “Join from Monday” doesn’t count.3. Working hours matter: You can’t make interns work 9–6 like full-time employees. Especially without the legal structure of employment. Intern ≠ invisible employee.4. Interns ≠ escape route for compliance: Don’t onboard interns just to avoid PF, ESI, or contract formalities. Labour departments have started cracking down on this in urban zones.5. Colleges are watching too: Many reputed institutions blacklist companies that exploit students during internships. Your employer brand is on the line.Bottom line:If interns are doing real work,They deserve real respect and real structure.Internship ≠ loophole.It’s a legal relationship, not a casual favor.P.S. If your “internship program” involves Excel sheets, 9-hour shifts, and zero pay - you didn’t hire an intern; you hired a ghost employee. khushi Atwalkhushi Atwal If you’re hiring interns to “save money,”You’re already out of compliance.Let’s clear up the biggest myth:Interns aren’t free labor.And your intent doesn’t override the law.Here’s what most companies get wrong:1. Sounds great, right? But as soon as you show interest, they say:👉 "First, pay for our training/course."👉 "You\'ll be eligible after enrolling."👉 The WhatsApp group disappears.👉 There’s no real interview — just payment links.This is a bait-and-switch strategy, where the real goal isn\'t to hire you — it’s to sell a course using false promises of jobs or internships.📌 No real company will ask you to pay for an internship.📌 If they offer money and ask for money in return — it\'s not a job, it\'s a trap.📌 Always ask: "Is this internship conditional on purchasing any training?"Please don’t waste your hard-earned money. Drop your CV atmail2neilacharjee@gmail.comGrab the opportunity asap!-With RegardsHR AssociateNeil Acharjeehashtag#HRInternshiphashtag#RemoteInternshiphashtag#Hiringhashtag#HRJobshashtag#InternshipOpportunityhashtag#HumanResourceshashtag#CareerGrowthhashtag#Recruitmenthashtag#JobSearchhashtag#Opportunitieshashtag#FlexibleWorkhashtag#WorkFromHomehashtag#TENhashtag#TheEntrepreneurshipNetworkhashtag#lpuhashtag#ipuniversityhashtag#amityuniversityhashtag#shardahashtag#noexperiencehashtag#corporatehashtag#studentshashtag#dseuhashtag#mbahashtag#engineeringhashtag#Economicshashtag#statisticshashtag#financehashtag#bcomhashtag#bahashtag#opportunityhashtag#bbahashtag#traineehashtag#collegehashtag#delhihashtag#mumbaihashtag#studenthashtag#lucknowhashtag#punehashtag#maharashtrahashtag#campusdrivehashtag#businessdevelopmenthashtag#workshophashtag#growhashtag#internhashtag#freshers', "How the hell am I supposed to justify hiring an intern or recent graduate in 2025?I already hear the agentic AI consortium laughing me out of timeline relevance as they vibe-code their way to another few million ARR (or at least a viral LinkedIn post).I’m not the only one worried.Aneesh Raman’s recent opinion inThe New York Times(https://lnkd.in/eNtFe_Rt) does a great job explaining how the outsourcing of simple tasks to AI, rather than juniors, removes a critical way that young workers gain experience.If I didn’t write hundreds of 160-character long promotional SMSs every month forJosé Soaresback in 2013, or labour over monthly performance reports with (admittedly basic) Excel analysis, I doubt my LinkedIn ads would be among LinkedIn’s top 1% performers a decade later.We're fighting over academic talent (see the recentHarvard Universityvs Trump international student drama). But I wonder what we’ll do with that talent once they graduate. Deeptech research may consider itself safe, but after reading AI 2027 (https://ai-2027.com/) I wonder how long good “research appetite” will protect them.I don’t have answers to the above grand challenges, but I do discuss how marketing can tackle this today with clients, as well asGrowthMentormentees, regularly. My advice:▶️ Split marketing into three pillars: Strategy, Production (writing content, building landing pages, launching digital campaigns), Operations (arranging events, submitting award proposals, setting up CRM workflows).▶️ Your Marketing leader should be doing all three. While significant time is spent on strategy, leadership should produce and run some operations to maintain perspective.▶️ Experts handle the bulk of production. These can be in-house FTEs, agencies, freelancers or even AI agents, but the goal is top quality driven by deep experience.▶️ Operations is where interns and recent graduates can shine because mindset and execution, rather than hard-skills and knowledge, are the success factors. Exposure to domain experts and real-world scenarios accelerates the transition from academia to a career.The above should help fresh faces into the marketing workforce, upskill rapidly through exposure, and benefit from their creative thinking.It might not be as efficient over the short term as “AI everything”, but I’d letKlarnaCEOSebastian Siemiatkowski's recentBloomberginterview end with a note on cost vs. quality:Siemiatkowski said that [an all-in on AI for customer support] strategy isn’t the right fit any more. “As cost unfortunately seems to have been a too predominant evaluation factor when organizing this, what you end up having is lower quality,” he said. “Really investing in the quality of the human support is the way of the future for us.”How do we blend quality, cost-efficiency, and social obligation to the next generation of talent together? Our Indian IT companies thankfully are still hiring but only because they are investing in the future.Compare that to the pandemic hiring frenzy when these companies added 120,000+ employees in a single year.What changed? 4 key factors:🔸 Pandemic Overhiring Hangover - Companies are still digesting their 2020-2022 hiring spree as demand normalized🔸 Rising Interest Rates - CFOs prioritizing margin discipline over headcount expansion🔸 AI Infrastructure Investment - Billions diverted to GPUs and data centers, leaving less for junior hires🔸 AI Replacing Entry-Level Work - Copilots and automation tools enabling teams to do more with lessThe traditional link between revenue growth and headcount growth is breaking. Companies are testing whether they can grow without growing their teams.For freshers navigating this storm:✅ Build portfolios, not just résumés✅ Master AI tools in your field✅ Freelance/intern strategically✅ Network beyond LinkedIn✅ Target smaller companies and emerging sectorsThe job market isn't broken—it's evolving. The future belongs to those who adapt early, learn fast, and stay visible. Reach out to us atBe Practical Tech Solutionsto understand how we are playing our role in creating such graduates.But here's the real truth - freshers who understand AI, build real projects, and think like founders aren't just employable—they're unstoppable.
